import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "AB12CD.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 2  # Page 3 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Beam", "Length", "Material"], ["B1", "5m", "Steel"], ["B2", "7m", "Concrete"]],
    font="Arial",
    fontsize=12
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import PDFbf

# File-level: "EF34GH.pdf"
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Target position extraction: page 7 (pagenumber=6), second rectangle (rectangleorder=1)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)
pagenumber = 6
rectangleorder = 1
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# First table: Content and formatting
argument1 = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "data": [["Load Case", "Description"], ["LC1", "Dead Load"], ["LC2", "Live Load"]],
    "font": "Times New Roman",
    "fontsize": 11
}
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument1["clip"], data=argument1["data"], font=argument1["font"], fontsize=argument1["fontsize"])
doc = table_adder1.addtable()

# Second table: Content and column widths
argument2 = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "data": [["Combination", "Factor"], ["LC1+LC2", "1.5"], ["LC1+0.5LC2", "1.2"]],
    "arrange": [None, [80, 80]]  # Column widths specified, row heights default
}
table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument2["clip"], data=argument2["data"], arrange=argument2["arrange"])
doc = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)
